group_1.textLeft: It did feel strange to hear that, thinking@back.
You brought up 'something that a film@director would absolutely need'...
And just as I was wondering what that wish@could entail, you said 'money'.

group_1.textRight: Well, I suppose you're right, Senpai...
Wishing for artistic sense as a director@would also be valid, generally speaking.
In fact, the idea did flash through my mind@for a moment...
But I thought that wishing for something like@that wouldn't be quite right, in the end.
Yes...

group_1.narration: My story takes us back one year,@when I was in my third year of middle school.
We begin on the day when my teacher interviewed@me about my future career aspirations...

group_1.textRight: If I recall correctly, Mihono-san...
You're planning to continue on to our@school's senior division, yes?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, and I still intend to.

group_1.textRight: That'll be these papers here, then.
One for students already attending school here.
It's only provisional, but we usually start@asking students around now.
It can inform things like your department,@course selection, class curriculum, and so on.
What sort of field would you like to go into@after graduating high school?

group_1.textLeft: Film directing!@[chara:303901:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:303901:cheek_0][chara:303901:face_mtn_ex_050.exp.json][chara:303901:lipSynch_1]...Is what I'd like to do, so...
I plan to attend a university or technical@school with a faculty related to film!

group_1.textRight: Really?@Well, having a clear goal is certainly good.
In that case, several graduates from our design@department have gone on to pursue film...
The design department offers opportunities to...
...Engage with film-related software, among@other things...
And if you qualify in your exams, you can select@certain advanced-placement courses as well.

group_1.textLeft: Oho! You've got everything and then some.@That sounds just perfect.

group_1.textRight: Ahh, but there's just one thing...
I remember that we've spoken to your parents@before, Mihono-san...
And they seemed quite keen on having your@courses lead to a degree...
That would help you find stable employment,@yes?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I think I remember that...?

group_1.textRight: Our AP courses don't offer that many classes@on exam prep for getting such a degree.
So this would conflict somewhat with your@parents' wishes...
Have you spoken with them about this yet?

group_1.textLeft: I'm sure they'll understand completely once@I do!

group_1.textRight: All of this *was* back when you were in first@year, to be fair.
Now then, we'll need you to show these forms@to your parents and get their signatures.

group_1.textLeft: (I'll probably chat with them about it after@dinner.)
